required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Toripalimab or Placebo Combined With Chemotherapy in Treatment-naive Advanced NSCLC
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Multi-center Clinical Study to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Toripalimab Injection (JS001) or Placebo Combined With First-line Standard Chemotherapy in Treatment-naive Advanced Non-small Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)

brief_summary.textblock:
This is one randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled, multi-center, phase III clinical study to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Toripalimab injection (JS001) or placebo combined with standard 1st-line chemotherapy in treatment-naïve advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC); and evaluate the population with the best predictive biomarkers, i.e., positive diagnosis population.
About 450 subjects with advanced non-small cell lung cancer without activated EGFR mutation (exon 19 deletion, or exon 21 L858R, exon 21 L861Q, exon 18 G719X or exon 20 S768I mutations) and ALK fusion will be 2:1 randomized into two groups, JS001 combined with the standard 1st-line chemotherapy will be given in the study group whereas placebo combined with standard 1st-line chemotherapy will be given in the control group. The stratification will be based on the following factors:
PD-L1 expression (TC≥1% vs TC＜1%); Smoking state (often smoking vs no smoking or infrequent smoking); Pathological type (squamous cell carcinoma vs non-squamous cell carcinoma).

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: Progression free survival (PFS) evaluated by investigators according to the response evaluation criteria in solid tumors (RECIST 1.1)

secondary_outcome.description: PFS evaluated by the Blinded Individual Review Committee (BIRC) based on RECIST1.1 criteria
Objective response rate (ORR) evaluated by investigators and BIRC based on RECIST1.1
Duration of response (DOR) evaluated by investigators and BIRC based on RECIST1.1
Disease control rate (DCR) evaluated by investigators and BIRC based on RECIST1.1
Time to response (TTR) evaluated by investigators and BIRC based on RECIST1.1

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of consent informed until 60 days after the last investigational product administration. Up to 2 approximately years
secondary_outcome.description: Overall incidence of adverse events (AEs); incidence of grade 3 and above AEs; incidence of serious adverse events (SAEs); incidence of AEs leading to termination of the investigational drug; incidence of AEs interruption of the investigational drug

clinical_study.condition: Treatment-naive Advanced Non-small Cell Lung Cancer

arm_group.arm_group_label: Group TORIPALIMAB combined with standard chemotherapy
Group Placebo combined with standard chemotherapy

intervention.description: TORIPALIMAB INJECTION(JS001 ) or Placebo ,240mg/6ml/vial, Q3W,up to 2 years of treatment.
intervention.arm_group_label: Group Placebo combined with standard chemotherapy
Group TORIPALIMAB combined with standard chemotherapy

facility.name: Cancer Hospital Chinese Academy of Medical Sciences
